thread.title: Aid workers: Bodies of 74 migrants wash ashore in Libya
thread.title_full: Aid workers: Bodies of 74 migrants wash ashore in Libya

author: USA TODAY
title: Aid workers: Bodies of 74 migrants wash ashore in Libya
text:
Aid workers: Bodies of 74 migrants wash ashore in Libya The Libyan Red Crescent said the bodies were recovered in the northwestern coastal city of Zawiya. Post to Facebook Aid workers: Bodies of 74 migrants wash ashore in Libya The Libyan Red Crescent said the bodies were recovered in the northwestern coastal city of Zawiya.  //usat.ly/2m3swEB   Join the Nation's Conversation To   Aid workers: Bodies of 74 migrants wash ashore in Libya Jane Onyanga-Omara , USA TODAY 5:03 a.m. ET Feb. 21, 2017 Refugees and migrants are seen on deck of the Spanish NGO Proactiva Open Arms rescue vessel Golfo Azzurro sailing towards the Italian port of Pozzallo after being rescued off Libyan coast north of Sabratha, Libya on Feb. 19, 2017. (Photo: David Ramos) CONNECT COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
The bodies of 74 migrants washed ashore on the Libyan coast after their boat sank in the Mediterranean Sea, aid workers said Tuesday. 
The Libyan Red Crescent said the bodies were recovered in the northwestern coastal city of Zawiya. 
Flavio Di Giacomo, a spokesman for the International Organization for Migration (IOM), the U.N. Migration Agency, said their vessel departed from the western city of Sabratha on Saturday with 110 people aboard. 
Sabratha, an important archaeological site and a launch point for migrants trying to reach Europe, was briefly seized by the Islamic State in 2016, according to media reports. 
The IOM said Tuesday that 13,170 migrants arrived in Europe by sea so far this year, and 272 were dead or missing. #Libya : Tragedy again today as #RedCrescent recover bodies of 74 people from a boat washed ashore near #Zawiya #StopIndifference #migration pic.twitter.com/YarPI5mYEG
